instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
Hello, I received a laptop <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, the touchbar does not work, there is no brightness on the keyboard and it does not recognize the usb ports either.

I already restored with dfu in appleconfigurator and always the same result.

I also tried another topcase and it makes the same error

diode mode compare with ic donnor board and same measures

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history available?
You mention different issues, which can't be related by the same power rail, or signals group.
Machine charges from USB-C ports, but no external device is recognized?
All ports have the same behavior?

Check if you get voltage at L3500 and LB700, when external USB-device is inserted into corresponding ports.

ALS works correctly?
Touchbar and keyboard backlight may be caused by non-working ALS.
<RESISTOR>R8435</RESISTOR>/36/46 have the correct values?
Post <DIODE>D8450</DIODE> voltage (both pins) with keyboard backlight sheet connected.

All voltages and signals on touchbar connectors have the same values like good board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
hi, laptop comes from another shop. board looks good, no water damage

owner says keyboard doesnt work , after measure i found DZ6701 reheat, after change DZ6701 keyboard works again. but a lot of problems, touchbar, bcklight keyboard, and usb devices

L3500 and LB700 voltage is 0 , with and without USB device connected
All ports have the same behavior


<RESISTOR>R8435</RESISTOR>/36  10ohm 
<SIGNAL>KBDLED_CATHODE1</SIGNAL>  0.05V
<SIGNAL>KBDLED_CATHODE2</SIGNAL> O.4V

<RESISTOR>R8446</RESISTOR>  5.1V both pins
<DIODE>D8450</DIODE> 5.1V both pins


i found on 
<RESISTOR>R5103</RESISTOR>   
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL>   0.99V
<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
"L3500 and LB700 voltage is 0"
Obly one must get voltage at a time, depending where the USB device is connected.
Unless both left/right sides are used at same time; then both coils must get voltage.
Check <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>, UB700 and adjacent components.

"ALS works correctly?"
???

"<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL>   0.99V"
Check <CHIP>U5104</CHIP> voltages; you may need to change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
Hi bro, ALS is working,

 L3500 and LB700 V0 when connect device

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
update: after replace <CHIP>U5104</CHIP> touchbar working perfect but no bkl on keyboard

also replace
<CHIP>U3500</CHIP> / <TRANSISTOR>Q3501</TRANSISTOR>
UB700 /QB701
no lucky no usb recognize

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message: Did you chck power and enable signals for <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> and UB700?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3500</CHIP>, or UB700 get enable signal ONLY when external device is connected into corresponding port; <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> controls left side.
Of course, 5V must be present always at their pins 19 & 20.

Enable signals come from <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips.

Should be good to check diode mode to ground on the USB connectors.
Do you have S-UEM2 tool?

What was the reason to change UB740?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
hi , again

Of course, I measure the voltage by connecting a USB device to the corresponding port. 5V are present on 19 &20pins.  I don't remember mentioning the change of the UB740 ic.

 I don't have the tool

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
Aaaah sorry, you've said check, not change.

Seems that <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips don't detect the external devices.
This problem may be caused by incorrect values on data lines.
As I said, need to check diode mode to ground the USB connectors (J3300/JB500).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message: diode mode measue are the same  a working board :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
Is the battery charging on all USB-C ports?
Check in both directions.

Try SMC reset, also PRAM reset.
Just in case, change L/<DIODE>D8450</DIODE>.

Check <CHIP>U8472</CHIP> voltages; remove it and solder 1-10K resistor between pads 4 & 5.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
yes, battery charge on all usb-c ports.

if i connect a usb-c 9 in 1 adapter and connect charger to 9 in 1  adapter and adapter to laptop usb devices are recognize.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message: A friend told me that he had a similar case and that he had to change <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>, I listened to him and replaced the 4 <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> but without luck, it still does not recognize usb devices

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchbar, no usb, no kb backlight
threads.message:
Not easy to work on boards with previously repair atempts.
There may be just a simple resistor, or trace, intentionally damaged.

The detection of the USB devices is based on the CC1/2 lines.
Some information you can find here:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://community.silabs.com/s/article/legacy-usb-device-detection-by-type-c?language=en_US[/URL]

Once corresponding <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip detects the USB device, it should enable its 5V power supply; <SIGNAL>UPC_X_5V_EN</SIGNAL>, for example.
